Package core.invoker

Interface InvokerInterface

All Superinterfaces:
Remote
All Known Implementing Classes:
CompositeInvoker, Invoker, ServerInvoker
public interface InvokerInterface extends Remote
The interface defining the contract for an Invoker in a distributed computing environment. Invokers are responsible for executing functions and managing resources.
See Also:
  • Remote

  • Method Details

    • getId

      String getId() throws RemoteException
      Gets the unique identifier of the Invoker.
      Returns:
      The unique identifier of the Invoker.
      Throws:
      RemoteException - If a remote communication-related exception occurs.

    • getUsedRam

      long getUsedRam() throws RemoteException
      Retrieves the amount of RAM currently in use by the Invoker.
      Returns:
      The amount of RAM currently in use.
      Throws:
      RemoteException - If a remote communication-related exception occurs.

    • getAvailableRam

      long getAvailableRam() throws RemoteException
      Retrieves the available RAM that can be used by the Invoker.
      Returns:
      The available RAM for use.
      Throws:
      RemoteException - If a remote communication-related exception occurs.

    • reserveRam

      void reserveRam(long ram) throws RemoteException
      Reserves a specified amount of RAM in MegaBytes for use by the Invoker.
      Parameters:
      ram - The amount of RAM to reserve in MegaBytes.
      Throws:
      RemoteException - If a remote communication-related exception occurs.

    • getMaxRam

      long getMaxRam() throws RemoteException
      Retrieves the maximum amount of RAM that can be used by the Invoker.
      Returns:
      The maximum RAM that can be used by this Invoker.
      Throws:
      RemoteException - If a remote communication-related exception occurs.

    • selectInvoker

      InvokerInterface selectInvoker(long ram) throws NoPolicyManagerRegistered, NoInvokerAvailable, RemoteException
      Selects an Invoker that has enough RAM to execute an Invokable consuming the specified RAM.
      Parameters:
      ram - The amount of RAM in MegaBytes that the Invokable will consume.
      Returns:
      The Invoker that will execute the function.
      Throws:
      NoPolicyManagerRegistered - If there is no PolicyManager registered with the Invoker.
      NoInvokerAvailable - If there is no Invoker with enough max RAM or a remote communication-related exception occurs.
      RemoteException - If a remote communication-related exception occurs.

    • invoke

      <T, R> R invoke(Invokable<T,R> invokable, T args, String id) throws Exception
      Executes a synchronous function passed by reference, applying observers and decorators.
      Type Parameters:
      T - The type of the input parameter for the Invokable.
      R - The type of the result returned by the Invokable.
      Parameters:
      invokable - The function to be executed and the RAM it consumes.
      args - The arguments needed by the function, of type T.
      id - The identifier of the function, needed by observers and decorators to store data correctly.
      Returns:
      The result of the function invoked, of type R.
      Throws:
      Exception - If an exception occurs during the invocation process.

    • invokeAsync

      <T, R> Future<R> invokeAsync(Invokable<T,R> invokable, T args, String id) throws Exception
      Executes an asynchronous function passed by reference. If there is no space in the pool of threads, it waits and then gets invoked.
      Type Parameters:
      T - The type of the input parameter for the Invokable.
      R - The type of the result returned by the Invokable.
      Parameters:
      invokable - The function to be executed asynchronously and the RAM it consumes.
      args - The arguments needed by the function, of type T.
      id - The identifier of the function, needed by observers and decorators to store data correctly.
      Returns:
      A Future representing the asynchronous result of invoking the function.
      Throws:
      Exception - If an exception occurs during the asynchronous invocation process.

    • shutdownInvoker

      void shutdownInvoker() throws RemoteException
      Shuts down the executor of the Invoker. Must be called when the application finishes.
      Throws:
      RemoteException - If a remote communication-related exception occurs.

    • setPolicyManager

      void setPolicyManager(PolicyManager policyManager) throws RemoteException
      Sets the PolicyManager for the Invoker.
      Parameters:
      policyManager - The PolicyManager to be set.
      Throws:
      RemoteException - If a remote communication-related exception occurs.

    • setDistributionPolicyManager

      void setDistributionPolicyManager(int size, long ram) throws NoInvokerAvailable, RemoteException
      If needed prepares the PolicyManager for a group invocation.
      Parameters:
      size - The size parameter for the Distribution PolicyManager.
      ram - The RAM parameter for the Distribution PolicyManager.
      Throws:
      NoInvokerAvailable - If there is no Invoker available based on the Distribution PolicyManager's strategy.
      RemoteException - If a remote communication-related exception occurs.

    • registerInvoker

      void registerInvoker(InvokerInterface invoker) throws OperationNotValid, RemoteException
      Registers an Invoker to a list in case this is a CompositeInvoker.
      Parameters:
      invoker - The Invoker to be registered.
      Throws:
      OperationNotValid - If the provided Invoker is null or if the Invoker is already registered.
      RemoteException - If a remote communication-related exception occurs.

    • deleteInvoker

      void deleteInvoker(InvokerInterface invoker) throws OperationNotValid, RemoteException
      Deletes an Invoker from a list in case this is a CompositeInvoker.
      Parameters:
      invoker - The Invoker to be registered.
      Throws:
      OperationNotValid - If the provided Invoker is null or if the Invoker is already registered.
      RemoteException - If a remote communication-related exception occurs.
